ext_descriptions.ext_description: The angle_reference_enumeration is a specification of the element the angle is measured from.
the angle is measured from a direction normal to the profile plane;
the angle is measured from the punch direction that is specified for the ;
the angle is measured from the actual surface normal.

The form_feature_in_panel_type is the kind of
that results from the application of the specified parameters.

the type of
is boss;

the type of
is pocket;

the type of
is stairstep.
The starting_or_ending is a type of extremity of the path.
the extremity is the end of the path.
the extremity is the start of the path.
The straight_or_tapered type specifies the shape of the .
the linear bead end is straight on the panel surface;
the linear bead end is tapered towards the end point.

A Bead_end_type is a type of
A Bead_end_type is the definition of a kind of end that characterizes a . Each Bead_end_type is either a , a , or a .
specifies to which extremity of the path the Bead_end_type applies.

A Bead_feature is a type of
A Bead_feature is a feature that is applied to panel parts to increase the stiffness of the part and for forming to control metal flow.
Figure 1 shows a Bead_feature and illustrates the results of the application of various
conditions.
Parameters defining a Bead_feature
specifies the blend radius where the Bead_feature meets the panel surface. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
specifies the usage of a profile that determines the cross section of the Bead_feature.

specifies the
objects that define the types of the bead's ends.
specifies the course along which the bead_profile is swept.

A Closed_profile_usage is a type of . A Closed_profile_usage is the identification of a
and possibly of a geometric transformation used to place the
in a reference coordinate space.

ext_description.p: A Compound_feature_in_panel is a type of .

In the case where the Compound_feature_in_panel is applied as a , all of its elements, except for
objects, shall be defined in their own local coordinate spaces, and then transformed into the coordinate space of the Compound_feature_in_panel. In the case where the Compound_feature_in_panel is applied as an , the Compound_feature_in_panel as well as all of its elements shall be defined in the coordinate space of the shape where it is applied.
ext_description.note:
A Compound_feature_in_panel enables the definition of complex features based on existing
definitions.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: specifies the kind of Compound_feature_in_panel.
A Compound_feature_in_panel_element is a type of . A Compound_feature_in_panel_element is the identification and, if necessary, the positioning of an element of a .

specifies the geometric transformation that defines the position and the orientation of the Compound_feature_in_panel_element in the coordinate space of the
in the case where the
is applied as a . In the case where the
is applied as an
the element_placement shall not be instantiated.

specifies the
or
that is the feature definition of the Compound_feature_in_panel_element.

specifies the
of which the Compound_feature_in_panel_element is a component. There shall exist two or more
elements for the Compound_feature_in_panel_element.

A Compound_feature_in_panel_element_relationship is a type of . A Compound_feature_in_panel_element_relationship is a relationship between two
objects that shall be applied consecutively when forming a .

specifies the
that is succeeding the other feature in the Compound_feature_in_panel_element_relationship.

specifies the
that is preceding the other feature in the Compound_feature_in_panel_element_relationship.

ext_description.p: A Directed_angle is a type of . A Directed_angle is an angle value and the specification of the element from which the angle is measured.

example.p: Figure 2 shows two examples of the use of an Directed_angle for the definition of a .

figure.title: Form features in panel defined by target boundaries and wall angels

ext_description.p:
specifies the
that represents the angle.
ext_description.note: Depending on the direction of the vector that serves as the reference for the angle measurement positive or negative values may be used.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: specifies the element the angle is measured from.

A Face_termination is a type of . A Face_termination is a condition specifying that a
extends from the rim of a panel to the next face with which the
intersects.

ext_description.p: A Form_feature_in_panel is a type of .

A Form_feature_in_panel is the definition of a local modification in the shape of a panel. This modification consists of a base boundary on the panel surface and of a target face that is a result of stamping the area that is enclosed by the base boundary.

The Form_feature_in_panel is specified either by two
objects or by a
and a . The use of two
objects is not valid. In the case of a Form_feature_in_panel that has its base boundary defined by a , the placement of the feature shall be in a way that the base profile lies on the surface of the original panel or as close as possible if the surface is not planar.
ext_description.note: In order to achieve intersection of the feature wall and the base surface it may be necessary to extend the wall linearly towards the base surface.
ext_description.p: The wall of the feature is a ruled surface. In the case of two profiles defining the feature, the following rule applies: If Pb is a point on the base, Pt the corresponding point on the target, Tb the tangent to the base profile in Pb, and V the surface normal in Pb or the punch direction respectively, then the scalar product (Pt - Pb) · (V × (Tb × V)) shall evaluate to zero. If no punch direction is specified, the surface normal shall be used for the definition of the ruled surface. In the case of one profile and an angle the rule for the ruled surface is implicit.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
specifies either a
on the panel surface, or an
that defines the base boundary by applying an angle to the target boundary.

specifies the blend of the edge where the Form_feature_in_panel meets the panel surface. The sum of the values of the base radius and target radius shall not exceed the minimum distance between the profile defining the base of the feature and the profile defining the target of the feature.

ext_description.p: specifies the kind of Form_feature_in_panel that results from the application of the specified parameters. The following values shall be used: 'boss', 'pocket', 'stairstep'.
ext_description.note: Usually a pocket in panel and a boss in panel don't differ in their shape but only in the function they perform.

example.p: Figure 3 shows an example for a Form_feature_in_panel of feature_type 'stairstep'.

figure.title: Panel feature with the shape of a 'stairstep'

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
specifies either a
that corresponds to the boundary of the target face, or a
that defines the target boundary by applying an angle to the base boundary.

ext_description.p:
specifies the
or the
that defines that end of the Form_feature_in_panel that results from its application.

The geometric elements representing the target shall be defined in the same Cartesian coordinate space as the Form_feature_in_panel. In the case of a Form_feature_in_panel defined by a base profile and a , the target_face shall also be specified.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.
ext_description.note: If the target_face is not specified explicitly, it is defined implicitly as a flat face bounded by the target profile.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: specifies the blend of the edge where the feature walls meet the target face. The sum of the values of the base radius and target radius shall not exceed the minimum distance between the profile defining the base of the feature and the profile defining the target of the feature.
A Hole_feature_in_panel is a type of . A Hole_feature_in_panel is a hole that is applied to a sheet like formed part.
specifies a closed profile defining the shape of the Hole_feature_in_panel.

ext_description.p: specifies the kind or shape of hole.
ext_description.example: 'circular' and 'rectangular' are examples for the hole_type.
ext_description.p: The value of this attribute need not be specified.

A Joggle_feature is a type of . A Joggle_feature is a change in elevation of a face along a rim designed to accommodate either clearance for the insertion of another part or a contact point for attachment of another part.

example.p: Figure 4 illustrates the meaning of the various parameters defining a Joggle_feature.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: specifies the radius of the blending between the base surface and that wall of the Joggle_feature that is specified by the start point of the defining path. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

specifies the radius of the blending between the base surface and that wall of the Joggle_feature that is specified by the end point of the defining path. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

specifies the
whose start and end point in combination with the angles at path start and path end define the location and orientation of the side walls of the Joggle_feature. The Joggle_feature is be defined in the same Cartesian coordinate space as the Joggle_feature and shall be coplanar with the panel.

specifies an angle between 0 degrees and 90 degrees that is measured between the
and a line starting at the start point of the . This line is being directed towards the rim of the panel that shall have the Joggle_feature. This line shall be coplanar with the panel, with the
and with one side wall of the Joggle_feature.

specifies an angle between 0 degrees and 90 degrees that is measured between the
and a line starting at the end point of the . This line is being directed towards the rim of the panel that shall have the Joggle_feature. This line shall be coplanar with the panel, with the
and with one side wall of the Joggle_feature.
specifies the distance between the panel surface and the top face of the Joggle_feature. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
specifies the slope angle of that side wall of the Joggle_feature that is defined by the line starting at the start of the .
specifies the slope angle of that side wall of the Joggle_feature that is defined by the line starting at the end of the .

specifies the type of
that defines the end condition of the Joggle_feature.

specifies the radius of the blending between the top surface and that wall of the Joggle_feature that is specified by the start point of the defining path. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

specifies the radius of the blending between the top surface and that wall of the Joggle_feature that is specified by the end point of the defining path. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

A Joggle_termination is a type of . A Joggle_termination is the end condition specifying the termination of a . A Joggle_termination is either a
or a .

A Linear_bead_end_type is a type of . A Linear_bead_end_type is an end condition of a
that shall follow a linear path out of the material.
specifies the length of the Linear_bead_end_type.
specifies the shape of the Linear_bead_end_type.

ext_description.p: A Locator_feature is a type of . A Locator_feature is a conical impression in a panel as shown in Figure 5 used to locate the panel in the tooling.

note.p: Locator_feature objects are usually created in early die strikes for further stamping.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: specifies the radius of the blending between the panel surface and the wall of the Locator_feature. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
specifies the diameter of the cone on the panel's surface.
specifies the opening angle of the cone.
specifies the radius of the rounded cone tip. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
An Open_bead_end_type is a type of . An Open_bead_end_type is an end condition of a bead that passes through the end of the part.

An Open_profile_usage is a type of . An Open_profile_usage is the identification of an
and possibly of a geometric transformation used to place the
in a reference coordinate space.

ext_description.p:
specifies a
which intersects the profile at the distance beyond which a feature that is created using this profile is considered to be cleared.
ext_description.note: The profile_limit may be used to specify the plane beyond which a cutter has to retract in order not to damage the profile.
ext_description.p: The value of this attribute need not be specified.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
specifies the
that is being used.

ext_description.p: A Panel_hole_with_barring is a type of . A Panel_hole_with_barring is a hole in a panel where the material is not completely punched out but partially bent in the punch direction.

example.p: Figure 6 shows an example of a Panel_hole_with_barring.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: specifies the angle about which the material is bent.

ext_description.p:
specifies the
that represents that portion of the panel that is actually punched out.
ext_description.note:
The difference in area between the barring_profile and the
is that portion of the panel that is bended at 90 degrees in punch direction.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: specifies the radius of the blending between the panel and the bent material. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
A Process_feature_in_panel is a type of . A Process_feature_in_panel is a feature that is defined to be applied to a sheet like part.

ext_description.p: specifies the stamping direction when manufacturing the Process_feature_in_panel.
ext_description.note: Usually, the punch_direction is the direction normal to the panel surface towards that side of the panel at which the resulting Process_feature_in_panel protrudes from the surface.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
A Profile_usage is a type of . A Profile_usage is the identification of a
and possibly of a geometric transformation used to place the Profile_usage in a reference coordinate space. Each Profile_usage is either a
or a .

specifies the geometric transformation that locates and orients the
in the reference coordinate space.

specifies the
that is used.
A Radiused_bead_end_type is a type of . A Radiused_bead_end_type is an end condition of a bead feature. It is defined by the rotation of the bead profile at the bead start or end about its y-axis.

ext_description.p:
A Value_termination is a type of . A Value_termination specifies a condition where a
has a specified depth.

example.p: Figure 7 shows a value terminated joggle feature.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: specifies the distance from the rim of the panel to a point that corresponds to the end of the .

specifies the slope angle of the terminating face of the
measured from the panel surface.
